section.name: Overview
section.p: This component is really just a test container for testing the other components. This container is not meant to be used in a production environment.
In order to same you a little coding, a base class has been provided for your test cases. Simply extend org.apache.fulcrum.testcontainer.BaseUnitTest and you are ready to go.

subsection.name: Extending the test case
subsection.p: In order to same you a little coding, a base class has been provided for your test cases. Simply extend org.apache.fulcrum.testcontainer.BaseUnitTest and you are ready to go.
The setUp and tearDown methods of BaseUnitTest will handle the lifecycle of the container for you. Each test will have a freshly initialized container in which to run.
To lookup and release components, call the lookup and release methods of BaseUnitTest.

By default, all tests will use the configuration files TestComponentConfig.xml and TestRoleConfig.xml located in the src/test directory. If you want to override that behavior, you can override the getConfigurationFileName() and/or getRoleFileName() methods.

subsection.name: Using the container directly
subsection.p: If you need more control over the container itself for your test, just don't extend the unit test provided with the container. Instead, embed the container directly in your test case. See the java docs for org.apache.fulcrum.testcontainer.Container for more information.
